Atahualpa, also Atahuallpa, Atabalipa (in Hispanicized spellings) or Atawallpa (
Aymara and Quechua) (c.150226 July 1533) was the last Sapa Inca (sovereign 
emperor) of the Inca Empire (Tawantinsuyu) before the Spanish conquest. 
Atahualpa inherited the Kingdom of Quito from his father the Sapa Inca ... 
Eventually, the Spanish executed Atahualpa, effectively ending the empire.
